intro: Echium italicum var. lusitanicum, commonly known as the Lusitanian thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny calyx that resembles a thimble. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It produces striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a valued addition to gardens and natural landscapes.
